title: An edition of the 1664 edition of La Rochefoucauld was published in 1670 by John Davies of Kidwelly (Epictetus Junior or Maxims of Modern Morality in Two Centuries, London). This fairly faithful translation was not known to Behn. Two new editions, both anonymous, were published in 1694. The competition was even fiercer for Fontenelle’s Entretiens: it was translated in Dublin in 1687 by Sir W[illiam] D[onville
